title: Police search for clues following fatal shooting in Flint
content:
FLINT, MI -- Police are investigating a shooting late Sunday night that left one person dead in Flint.
Officers were called around 11 p.m. Dec. 11 to the 4500 block of Ogema Avenue, near MacDonald Avenue for a shooting and found a male dead at the end of a home's driveway.
A section of the street has been blocked off as Flint police and Michigan State Police comb over the snow-covered scene for clues.
Police offered a possible suspect vehicle description of a white, four-door car with side tinted windows and a grey stripe running down the middle of the doors with four occupants inside.
The shooting death is the second in less than one week's time in Flint. A man in his 30s was shot to death Tuesday, Dec. 6 in the 600 block of Crawford Street, off Grand Traverse Street, near the Burton border.
Flint police Lt. Jason Cate said police were called around 5:45 p.m. Tuesday, Dec. 6 to the 600 block of Crawford Street, off South Grand Traverse Street for a shooting and found the man.
Anyone with information on the fatal shooting may contact the Flint Police Department at 810-237-6800 or anonymously to Crime Stoppers at 1-800-422-JAIL (5245).
